In "Driverless Cars Are Coming," the author explains how self-driving cars function and why human oversight remains essential for safety.  However, I believe self-driving cars are unnecessary.

While some may embrace the concept, I remain unconvinced.  The article itself reveals that these vehicles aren't truly autonomous, stating, "They can steer, accelerate, and brake themselves, but all are designed to notify the driver when the road ahead requires human skills, such as navigating through work zones and around accidents. This means the human driver must remain alert and be ready to take over when the situation requires."  If these cars require a driver, they shouldn't be marketed as "driverless."  Humans are already successfully navigating roads worldwide.

Instead of developing autonomous vehicles, manufacturers should focus on enhancing existing car technology to improve safety and ease of use for human drivers.  The primary motivation behind self-driving cars seems to be accident prevention.  However, a more effective approach would be to improve driver awareness of their surroundings.  We've already begun this process with rearview cameras for parking.  Extending this concept by adding cameras to the sides of vehicles would eliminate blind spots. Currently, drivers must look away from the road to check adjacent lanes, risking a collision if another vehicle is in their blind spot.  Driving itself isn't difficult; we simply need assistance with certain challenges.

Ultimately, cars don't need to drive themselves.  Drivers need better tools to see their surroundings and ensure safety.  Instead of requiring drivers to compensate for a car's limitations, the car should assist the driver with their challenges.

These humans! I usually tolerate them, with their oohing and awwing at my admittedly attractive wings and melodious voice. But a new crowd has appeared these past few weeks. They’re a smelly bunch – smellier than usual, and hairy.  Instead of appreciating my generous serenades, they turn their backs and shout chants at the other zoo patrons, drowning out my beautiful song.

And today was the worst. They cut a nasty gash in my enclosure fence! It's twice my size. What if something gets in? They keep whistling at me, trying to coax me out, but why should I leave my home?

They ran off before my feeders arrived. I tried to show the oblivious humans who work here the gaping hole, but they didn't even notice!  How rude.

But a few minutes ago, I finally heard her – a ladybird, just my type.  Her song hinted at interest. Now I'm almost glad they damaged my enclosure.

I flew out, suffering only a minor scratch. I followed her voice. She's outside, but it's cold out here. Maybe she'll agree to come back to the exhibit with me. There are plenty of loose twigs for nest-building, should we be so inclined.

First, I have to see her.

If only these confounded, smelly humans weren't in my way! I think they have my ladybird, too! I can hear her coming from a small black box in one of their smelly hands… It must be some sort of bigger-on-the-inside contraption.

Australia se enfrenta a una nueva ola de confinamientos debido al aumento de contagios de la variante Delta del coronavirus, altamente contagiosa. Cerca de 10 millones de australianos, casi la mitad de la población, se verán afectados por las restricciones en varias ciudades del país.  Esta situación contrasta con la percepción de que la nación estaba prácticamente libre de la pandemia.  El gobierno conservador ha recibido críticas por la lentitud de la campaña de vacunación y las fallas en los sistemas de cuarentena para viajeros internacionales, consideradas las principales causas del rebrote.

A partir del martes por la noche, los habitantes de Brisbane y varias zonas del estado de Queensland se sumarán a los de Sidney, Darwin y Perth en un confinamiento de al menos tres días.  La primera ministra de Queensland, Annastacia Palaszczuk, justificó la medida: "Son decisiones difíciles. Hay confinamientos en las grandes ciudades porque el virus entra con las llegadas del extranjero".  El confinamiento en Queensland se desencadenó por el caso de un miembro del personal sanitario no vacunado que viajó por el estado durante diez días mientras estaba contagiado.  En Queensland, la medida también afecta a zonas del litoral y a la ciudad de Townsville, permitiendo solo las salidas para actividades esenciales.

Perth, en Australia Occidental, también inició un confinamiento de cuatro días este martes tras la detección de tres casos positivos. El primer ministro de Australia Occidental, Mark McGowan, explicó la decisión: "Conocemos los riesgos del Covid y, observando el mundo, sabemos que la variante Delta es una nueva bestia con la que no podemos arriesgarnos".

Estos confinamientos, que coinciden con las vacaciones escolares, amenazan con generar numerosas cancelaciones turísticas, ya que los estados no afectados recomiendan a sus habitantes evitar las zonas con casos.  Nueva Zelanda, por su parte, planea reabrir parcialmente su "burbuja" para viajes con Australia a partir del 5 de julio, pero solo con estados libres de casos.

El primer ministro australiano, Scott Morrison, bajo presión, anunció la obligatoriedad de la vacuna para el personal de residencias de ancianos y centros de cuarentena.  A pesar de haberse administrado unas 7,4 millones de dosis, se estima que menos del 5% de los 25 millones de australianos están completamente vacunados, un dato que el gobierno se ha resistido a publicar y que ha generado críticas.  Incluso el nuevo viceprimer ministro, Barnaby Joyce, fue multado por no usar barbijo.

El principal foco epidémico sigue siendo Sidney, con 150 contagios desde mediados de junio, lo que llevó a un confinamiento de dos semanas que comenzó el domingo.  Desde el inicio de la pandemia, Australia ha registrado poco más de 30.000 casos y 910 muertes.

Fuente: AFP

葡萄牙球王C罗 (Cristiano Ronaldo) 的Instagram追踪人数突破3亿，成为全球追踪人数最多的用户。这惊人的粉丝量也为他带来巨大的商业价值。根据英国分析公司Hopper HQ在2021年7月1日公布的Instagram「富人榜」，C罗平均每篇业配贴文可赚进160万美元，高居榜首，击败了好莱坞演员巨石强森 (Dwayne Johnson) 和美国小天后亚莉安娜 (Ariana Grande) 等人。巨石强森和亚莉安娜的Instagram贴文平均价格分别为152万美元和151万美元。

C罗的Instagram追踪人数自2020年初至今已增加超过1.25亿。随着疫情期间追踪人数的增加，他的每篇贴文报酬也水涨船高。2019年，C罗一篇贴文的报酬为88.9万美元，一年后几乎翻了一倍。据估计，这位36岁的足球员每年可从Instagram赚取超过4000万美元，甚至高于他在义甲尤文图斯的薪水。

##  Software Decodes Facial Expressions: A New Era of Emotional Understanding

A groundbreaking new software program promises to revolutionize how we perceive and interpret emotions.  This innovative technology boasts impressive accuracy in recognizing facial expressions, opening up exciting possibilities across various industries. Imagine a computer analyzing your face and providing a detailed emotional breakdown: 83% happy, 9% disgusted, 6% fearful, and 2% angry.  While this might sound like science fiction, this technology is now a reality.

The software's functionality hinges on the work of Dr. Paul Ekman, creator of the Facial Action Coding System (FACS).  It begins by constructing a 3D model of the face, mapping 44 major muscles known as "action units."  By analyzing the subtle movements and combinations of these action units, the software decodes the emotional state of the individual.  Dr. Huang, a researcher working with the software, notes that facial expressions for each emotion are universal, mirroring the intricate "calculations" humans perform unconsciously every day. We instinctively interpret our friends' emotions based on their facial expressions and vocal cues; this software replicates and quantifies that innate human ability.

The potential applications of this technology are far-reaching.  In the realm of advertising, an online ad player could tailor subsequent ads based on a user's facial reaction. A smile might prompt similar content, while a frown could trigger a different advertising strategy.

## إعادة هيكلة النص العربي

بقلم محمود محيي الدين الخبير الاقتصادي المصري نقلا عن الشرق الأوسط –

تفصلنا أعوام وأشهر قليلة عن بداية التداول الموسع لعملات رقمية تصدرها البنوك المركزية وتجد طريقها لمحافظ رقمية على تطبيقات هاتفية يحملها عموم الناس بلا حاجة إلى أوراق بنكنوت أو حسابات مصرفية.  سيحدث هذا النظام الجديد، في تقديري، طفرة في الكفاءة المالية وتخفيض تكلفة المعاملات وزيادة الشمول المالي، ولكنه سيستوجب تغييراً في أنماط عمل القطاع المالي ونظمه التشغيلية وقواعد المنافسة والابتكار وتطوير الخدمات للعملاء وقواعد التعرف عليهم كمدخرين ومقترضين.  لكن النقلة الأكبر ستكون على صعيد النظام النقدي الدولي وإدارة الاحتياطي من النقد الأجنبي. فرقمنة العملة ستدخل لاعبين جدداً في الساحة الدولية ممن ستكون لهم الغلبة في تكنولوجيا العملة الدولية وقواعد البيانات الكبرى وإدارتها بنظم الذكاء الصناعي.

وعلى اختلاف أشكال النقود وتطورها، فعليها دائماً الوفاء بوظائف ثلاث مجتمعة: أن تكون وحدة للحساب، ومخزناً للقيمة، ووسيطاً للتبادل. وإذا فقدت النقود أياً من وظائفها الثلاث ضاعت الثقة بها وبحث الناس عن بديل عنها. وقد نقل مارك كارني، محافظ بنك إنجلترا، في كتابه الأخير عن القيمة والقيم، عن الاقتصادي الأمريكي هايمان منسكي مقولة مفادها «أي شخص يمكنه أن يخلق النقود، المشكلة ستكمن في قبولها»، وهذا القبول، كما نعلم، منوط بالثقة. والثقة في عالم المال تحتاج إلى سنوات طوال لبنائها، وثوانٍ لتحطيمها، وزمن طويل في محاولة استعادتها.

وقد أحدثت الأزمة المالية العالمية لعام 2008 اهتزازاً في الثقة بالبناء المالي ومؤسساته، ولجأ الناس إلى بدائل لنظام مالي تبين ارتفاع مخاطره وعدم شموله للكافة وارتفاع تكاليف إدارته. فتكلفة المعاملات المالية بين البنوك ووحدات الوساطة المالية التي يتحملها الأفراد تتراوح بين 0.5 في المائة و2 في المائة لكل معاملة، وتصل إلى أضعاف هذه النسب في حالة تسوية معاملات عبر الحدود أو القيام بتحويل مصرفي. وما زال هدف تخفيض تكلفة تحويل الأموال عبر الحدود لنسبة 3 في المائة أمراً صعب المنال رغم التوصيات الدولية.

مع مستجدات العصر الرقمي وتطور تكنولوجيا سلسلة الكتل «البلوك تشين»، يبدو أننا أمام ثلاثة بدائل، أرجّح هيمنة ثالثها، في تطور النقود:

**أولاً: الأصول المالية المشفرة:** رغم ارتفاع أسعار هذه الأصول المالية مثل البيتكوين وأخواتها، فإنها شديدة التقلب وعالية المخاطرة، بما يحرمها من وظيفة حيوية للنقود كمخزن للقيمة، كما يعقد استخدامها كوحدة للحساب إلا بربطها بما يعادلها من عملات متداولة مثل الدولار، وهذا يجعل شيوع استخدامها كوسيط للتبادل محل شك. لا أرى أن هذه الأصول المالية ستختفي بعدما أوجدت لنفسها تصنيفاً عالياً في المخاطرة متقلباً في العائد في محافظ المضاربة المالية.

Year 0, Day 1

I stumbled upon a rundown shack amidst my panic.  It's grey and tin, seemingly falling apart, and I doubt its safety as a long-term shelter.  However, finding it was a lifesaver. Inside, I discovered a few useful supplies, including a knife – a much better option for hunting small game than the pen I'd planned on using.  Despite this stroke of luck, finding a more secure shelter remains a top priority.


Year 20, Day 364

Heading west, back towards civilization, I came across a valley containing a rusted metal shack.  The tin structure, strikingly familiar, was mostly empty, likely looted at some point.  Despite its dilapidated state, the shack resonated with an odd sense of importance.

Tomorrow marks my return to the world I left behind.  I can't help but wonder if anyone will even remember me.

Levi Percy, unshaven, unkempt, and in a dirty suit, shuffled out of the medical firm, head hung low.  This was the third rejection that day. “They’ll come around eventually,” he muttered, clutching his briefcase. At first glance, he was a broken man, dismissed as a liar, a quack, an enemy of science.  But within that battered briefcase, Percy carried what he believed to be the most powerful concoction known to man – a cure-all potion. A single sip, he claimed, could eradicate any ailment, from cancer to the common cold. Not magic, he insisted, just the invention of an eccentric mind.  Unfortunately for Percy, that eccentricity branded him a madman, and nobody believed a madman.

“Sir, if you just TRY it! Just test it in a lab! Please, just…” His plea had been cut short inside, yet again.

“Mister Percy,” the dismissive voice had echoed.  “Nobody wants to try any of your potions. They don’t work, and you are becoming a real thorn in my side. Now please leave our facilities before I call security…again.”

“You’re making a mistake!” Percy had retorted, finger raised in protest. “A grave mistake!”

“Securit…”

“I’m going!”

Undeterred by the latest rejection, Percy’s spirits remained stubbornly high. He immediately resumed his relentless campaign, accosting a nearby group of people. “What if I told you that I have in my hands a bottle of the most miraculous stature?” he announced. “A bottle of life itself! Why, just one sip will cure you of all your sickness and sorrows! From cancers and tumors to broken bones and nosebleeds, this potion can cure it all. Even the rainy-day blues don’t stand a chance!”

But as always, nobody believed him.

Back on the streets, his ambition undimmed, Percy continued his lonely crusade. He was destined to remain neither rich nor famous.  In a cruel twist of fate, the man who believed he held the key to human health was powerless to convince anyone.  His genius, if it was that, was masked by the ravings of a perceived lunatic. He was the archetype of the unrecognized innovator, forever unable to gain a foothold in a world of skeptics.  If only they would listen… But nobody listened to poor, poor Mister Percy.

## إعادة هيكلة النص العربي

تزايدت في الآونة الأخيرة تحذيرات المختصين من مخاطر الاستثمار في أسواق العملات، خاصةً مع انتشار تجارة المضاربة بشكل كبير في المملكة.  وحذروا من إمكانية فقدان كامل رأس المال في يوم واحد، مطالبين الجهات الرسمية بتثقيف المستثمرين وحمايتهم من حملات التسويق المضللة التي تجذبهم نحو الهاوية الاستثمارية.

وتُعد أسواق العملات "الفوركس" ذات مخاطر عالية، ولا يُنصح بالدخول فيها لغير المختصين.  فهي تُستخدم أساساً للتحوّط من مخاطر تقلبات أسعار الصرف من قبل التجار والمستوردين، وليست للمضاربة، لما تنطوي عليه من مخاطر كبيرة.

Regression, a core problem in system identification, machine learning, and statistics, focuses on constructing models from noisy input-output data.  The primary goal is to estimate the regression function, which encodes the conditional expectation of the output given an input, based on a finite sample (Cucker and Zhou, 2007).  Established approaches include least squares, prediction error and instrumental variable methods, neural networks, and kernel machines (Györfi et al., 2002).

While these methods often provide point estimates, robust approaches and risk management require region estimates.  Traditionally, such regions are constructed using the asymptotic distribution of scaled estimation errors. However, non-asymptotic and distribution-free methods are preferable in practice.  Different types of region estimates exist: confidence regions in the parameter space (Csáji et al., 2014), confidence or credible bands for expected outputs (Rasmussen and Williams, 2006), and prediction regions for future observations (Vovk et al., 2005; Garatti et al., 2019). This paper concentrates on constructing simultaneous confidence bands for the regression function, a task challenging in nonparametric settings, unlike parametric settings where confidence regions in the parameter space suffice.

Gaussian process regression offers a powerful framework for Gaussian data, providing prediction regions for outputs and credible regions for expected outputs (Rasmussen and Williams, 2006).  However, the Gaussianity assumption is often too restrictive, motivating alternative approaches with weaker assumptions.

Recently, a novel non-asymptotic, distribution-free method was proposed to build data-driven confidence bands for bounded, band-limited regression functions using Paley-Wiener kernels (Csáji and Horváth, 2022).  This method requires mild assumptions: symmetric, input-independent noise, and i.i.d. input-output pairs.  However, it assumes a known, uniform input distribution.

This paper introduces three refinements to this method:

(1) We replace the symmetric noise assumption with a distributional invariance principle. While i.i.d. noise already satisfies distributional invariance to permutations, this generalization removes the symmetry requirement.  Existing symmetry, if known, can still be incorporated into the transformation group.

(2) We propose a more efficient method for estimating the L2 norm of the target bandlimited function by tightening the constraints of the underlying convex optimization problem.

(3) We further apply this constraint tightening to the construction of confidence intervals at each input, leading to less conservative region estimates.

These refinements maintain the original method's guarantees and are supported by theoretical analysis and numerical experiments.

The "Face on Mars," a peculiar landform captured in images by the Mars Global Surveyor in 1976, sparked considerable speculation.  While some believed it to be evidence of extraterrestrial construction, scientific analysis reveals a more natural explanation.  The initial image, with its low resolution of 43 meters per pixel, contributed to the illusion of a face.  Subsequent images taken in 1998, and particularly in 2001 with a resolution of 1.56 meters per pixel, progressively clarified the landform's true nature. The improved clarity of the 2001 image revealed a rounded, smooth, natural mesa, debunking the artificiality suggested by the earlier, blurrier photographs.

The location of this mesa within the Cydonian region of Mars is also significant.  Cydonia is known for its abundance of mesas, and, as scientists quickly pointed out, the "Face" is just another example, albeit one with unusual shadowing that initially created a resemblance to an Egyptian Pharaoh.  This explanation, widely disseminated through the internet, helped to quell the initial excitement surrounding the image.  The 1998 image, taken during a cloudy period on Mars, likely further obscured the mesa's true form, contributing to the ongoing mystery.

Despite scientific consensus classifying the "Face" as a natural landform, some still maintain the possibility of alien construction. However, the progression of images, from the blurry 1976 photo to the clear 2001 image, provides compelling visual evidence of its natural origin.  Therefore, the "Face on Mars" stands as a testament to the power of image resolution and the importance of scientific scrutiny, demonstrating how initial perceptions can be transformed with improved data and wider dissemination of information.  While it may remain a subject of fascination, the evidence strongly supports the conclusion that the "Face on Mars" is a natural geological formation, shaped by the forces of nature rather than by alien hands.

The increased availability of computational power has encouraged the analysis of system performance through large datasets. In most complex physical and cyber-physical systems [1], relevant data originates from embedded sensors.  To draw inferences from this collected data, many systems require a large number of sensors. However, redundancies often exist; multiple sensor readings can be derived from each other due to inherent relationships among the system parameters they monitor.

Exploiting these relationships offers significant improvements in system design, including reduced power consumption and minimized maintenance and operational costs.  Critically, in some systems, sensor failure can lead to catastrophic consequences [2], [3]. Upon detecting such failures [4], [5], virtual sensors can provide redundancy, supplementing or replacing the malfunctioning physical sensors.

Virtual sensors are not physically present but are emulated. Their readings are derived from other embedded sensors.  This streamlined system realization requires identifying sensor clusters to understand inter-sensor relationships and the mapping between observed and virtual sensor readings.

In large-scale systems, data collected over extended periods can be overwhelming. Applying standard clustering algorithms to such high-dimensional datasets is often infeasible [6].  Advanced computational capabilities are needed for efficient segregation into clusters, necessitating robust clustering algorithms.

Previous research has explored virtual sensors for various applications. Model-based methods using non-linear state estimation techniques have been developed for aircraft [7], [8], but these are difficult to generalize to other non-linear systems without robust system-specific models.  Our proposed data-driven approach requires no prior domain knowledge.  Neural networks have been used for virtual sensors in pilot aid, diagnostics, and emission monitoring [9], but these assume prior knowledge of the target sensors.  Our work identifies virtual sensors through clustering. Entropy-based correlation for sensor clustering and representative sensor identification has been explored [10], but this approach doesn't address the challenges of high sampling rates and high-dimensional data leading to unstable cluster partitions, nor does it recover non-representative sensor data through supervised learning.  While [11] exploits spatiotemporal relationships using bidirectional LSTMs, input sensor selection relies on manual correlation analysis.  Adaptive sampling techniques have been used to address high sampling rates for energy conservation [12].  Our approach uses virtual sensors to obtain readings without physical sampling.

The efficacy of Ant Colony optimization for clustering has been demonstrated [13]. Inspired by this, we propose FAC2T (Fusion using Ant Colony Clustering Technique), a heuristic algorithm that estimates the globally optimal clustering solution by fusing solutions obtained from applying K-Means [14] to data subsets.  FAC2T also constrains the number of clusters.

This paper presents an end-to-end algorithmic solution for emulating virtual sensors.  Our major contributions are:

1. FAC2T: An Ant Colony inspired algorithm for clustering high-dimensional data.
2. An end-to-end algorithmic solution for emulating virtual sensors in complex systems.

## 第五章 餐饮业发展关键报告

（前略）

**第三节 国际餐饮业发展情势与展望**

本节分析全球餐饮产业概况，首先探讨主要国家餐饮业现况，其次探讨主要国家餐饮业发展案例，最后了解国际主要外送平台。

**一、全球餐饮业发展现况**

1. **美国**

美国作为世界强国之首，拥有全球最发达的资本市场，其在管理服务、连锁经营和集中化程度等方面均处于全球领先地位。上市餐饮企业的发展情况对全球餐饮市场具有重要的参考价值。根据美国普查局（United States Census Bureau）数据（参见表5-3-1），美国餐饮业销售额从2015年的6,234.94亿美元持续攀升，2018年突破7,000亿美元大关，2019年更达到7,657.96亿美元，年增长率约为4.0%~8.5%。此外，餐饮服务业是美国第二大劳动产业，根据美国劳动部（United States Department of Labor）数据（参见表5-3-2），餐饮业受雇员工人数从2015年的1,127.13万人增长至2019年的1,220.33万人，增幅约为8.27%。

2. **中国大陆**

中国大陆作为全球第二大经济体，人口总数超过14亿。随着生活方式的改变，餐饮业快速增长，中国大陆已成为仅次于美国的世界第二大餐饮市场。

The ultimate power – the ability to stop time and affect the world around me. When I first discovered this gift, I used it judiciously: stopping time to exercise, read, even intervene in crises.  Stopping a rape, a murder, then seamlessly slipping back into my regular life. It felt like a dream. Until I understood the hidden cost.

I aged even while time stood still.  The effect wasn't noticeable at first, as I’d never frozen time for extended periods, always fearing unforeseen consequences. But when I turned 40, my doctor revealed a startling truth. Despite my healthy lifestyle and peak physical condition, my body mirrored that of a 60-year-old.

That night, I wrestled with the implications.  I recalled the origin of my powers: an ancient man who claimed to have observed me, tested my worthiness, and ultimately bestowed this gift. My life, it seemed, was destined to be short.

دبي - محمود عبدالرازق - أفاد تقرير مطول نشرته وكالة عمون، اليوم الجمعة، أن التقرير السنوي للحوادث المرورية في الأردن، الصادر عن مديرية الأمن العام،  أكد انخفاض عدد وفيات حوادث الطرق بنسبة 28.3%، حيث سُجلت 461 وفاة عام 2020، مقابل 643 وفاة خلال عام 2019.

ووفقاً للتقرير، يقع حادث مروري ينتج عنه خسائر بشرية كل ساعة تقريباً، وحادث دهس كل 3 ساعات، فيما يُصاب شخص كل 41 دقيقة، ويتسبب حادث مروري بوفاة واحدة كل 19 ساعة.

وأظهر التقرير أيضاً أن  حادثة واحدة من بين كل 1000 سيدة تحمل رخصة قيادة تسببت بها امرأة، بينما ارتكب 6 رجال من بين كل 1000 رجل يحملون رخصة قيادة حوادث نتج عنها إصابات بشرية.

وعزت مديرية الأمن العام في تقريرها أسباب كثرة الحوادث وارتفاع معدل الوفيات فيها إلى قلة ممرات المشاة والجسور المخصصة لعبور الطرق، بالإضافة إلى احتلال بعض أرصفة الشوارع والاعتداءات المستمرة عليها.

As usual, it had been a long, tiring day. I sank onto the sofa, tossing my bag onto the nearby table.  Slowly, I drifted off to sleep. My imagination took over, and I vividly experienced a dream inspired by an encounter earlier that day.  During lunch with a colleague, a small boy, no older than ten, stood outside the canteen cleaning the windowpanes. He was covered in grease from head to toe, his clothes filthy and his shoes torn, yet his cherry-red lips and droopy eyes held all the innocence imaginable.

It began to rain, and after a while, he shivered. He slumped against the base of the window, facing me. I was sipping my coffee.  As our gazes met, I found it difficult to swallow. The stark contrast between my warm comfort inside the cafe and the boy, now half-drenched, was a pang of guilt in my chest.  His face betrayed no resentment for his circumstances. I called him over and offered him a cup of tea, which he gratefully accepted.  "Don't you feel cold?" I asked.  "No," he replied, "I feel close to nature." I was deeply moved by his spirit, his inherent love for nature, and his appreciation for the smallest things – things I had failed to notice. He had shown me something awe-inspiring. I wished I had a magic wand to erase his poverty with a flick of the wrist and fill his childhood with all the beauty he deserved.

Geraldine followed the squire down the hallway, her gaze fixed on the gleaming chainmail they had provided just the day before.  *This is impressive gear,* she thought.

They soon arrived at the Earl's chamber.

"Sir," the squire announced, gesturing for Geraldine to step forward, "allow me to present the newest member of your personal guard."

The Earl regarded her with a near-imperceptible smile.

"My name is Geraldine," she said with a bow. "I am at your service."

The Earl reached for a sword – her new sword, as she would soon learn.  He offered her the hilt.  She grasped it with both hands and, in a swift, decisive motion, lunged, driving the blade into his chest, directly at his heart. Blood spurted from the wound.  His eyes widened in horror as he collapsed.

For a fleeting moment, Geraldine looked down at him, lying in a growing pool of blood.  Then a sharp pain pierced her back.

*Now I can rest,* she thought as she lay dying beside the man who had murdered her parents.

L'Irlande, aux côtés de l'UE, plaide depuis le référendum de 2016 pour une absence de frontière physique avec l'Irlande du Nord après le Brexit.  Cette unité de front s'effrite cependant face au risque croissant d'un "no deal".  Jusqu'ici, Dublin, fort de l'accord de retrait prévoyant le "filet de sécurité" – solution censée éviter le retour d'une frontière physique –, pouvait éviter d'aborder frontalement la question. Ce dispositif, maintenant l'ensemble du Royaume-Uni dans une union douanière avec l'UE, est toutefois décrié par les pro-Brexit qui y voient un arrimage permanent à l'UE.  Le rejet de l'accord par le parlement britannique le 15 janvier a relancé le débat, Londres souhaitant renégocier la question irlandaise, et notamment le "filet de sécurité".

Pendant des mois, les autorités européennes et irlandaises ont soigneusement évité d’évoquer les conséquences pratiques d'une frontière physique sur les 500 kilomètres et plus de 200 routes la séparant de l'Irlande du Nord.  Cette semaine, le porte-parole de la Commission européenne, Margaritis Schinas, a brisé le tabou. Interrogé sur les conséquences d’un Brexit sans accord, sa réponse fut sans ambages : «Vous aurez une frontière dure».  Ces propos, perçus par le journal *The Irish Independent* comme un «coup de poignard dans le dos», ont pris Dublin de court.  Le gouvernement de Leo Varadkar a immédiatement rappelé l’UE à ses engagements. M. Schinas a par la suite nuancé ses propos, affirmant la détermination de l’UE à éviter une frontière dure «accord ou pas accord».

Pourtant, l’Irlande, subissant malgré elle le Brexit, se sent sous pression. «Pourquoi est-ce le pays qui subit qui doit toujours faire des concessions ?», s’est interrogé Leo Varadkar sur Bloomberg TV.  Le négociateur en chef de l’UE, Michel Barnier, a tenté d'apaiser les tensions, déclarant qu'il faudrait «trouver un moyen opérationnel d’effectuer des vérifications et des contrôles sans remettre en place une frontière».  Ces propos, pourtant, n'ont fait que soulever de nouvelles interrogations.  Le Premier ministre irlandais, critiqué dans son pays pour son manque de préparation à ce scénario, maintient une position jugée «raisonnable» par Federico Fabbrini, directeur du Brexit Institute de la Dublin City University : «Il ne veut pas prendre de mesures tant qu’on peut éviter le retour d’une frontière».

Pour les pro-Brexit, les déclarations de M. Barnier prouvent qu'une alternative au "filet de sécurité" est envisageable.  Leo Varadkar, quant à lui, a prévenu qu'un "no deal" engendrerait une «période de chaos» avec potentiellement «des caméras, des infrastructures physiques, et une présence policière voire militaire» à la frontière. Un changement radical vingt ans après le démantèlement des derniers postes de contrôle, symbole de l'accord de paix. À terme, selon lui, l'UE, le Royaume-Uni et l'Irlande devront «se mettre d’accord sur un alignement complet» entre l'Irlande du Nord et la République d'Irlande.  Seamus Leheny, de la FTA (Association de transport de fret) en Irlande du Nord, craint le pire : «Des centaines de camions pourraient stationner à la frontière en attente des autorisations».  L'image des "anti-Brexit" vêtus en soldats et douaniers britanniques devant une banderole symbolisant la frontière à Newry, le 26 janvier 2019, illustre l'inquiétude palpable.

Reinforcement learning (RL) has become a prominent area of artificial intelligence research, demonstrating strong empirical performance in diverse applications such as algorithm design (Fawzi et al., 2022), physical process control (Degrave et al., 2022), drug and molecular design (Popova et al., 2018; Zhou et al., 2019), optimizing chemical reactions (Zhou et al., 2017), natural language processing (OpenAI, 2023), and game playing (Silver et al., 2018).  This success has attracted a growing number of students at the bachelor's, master's, and early PhD levels.  These students require effective teaching materials, typically relying on textbooks (Sutton & Barto, 2018; Wiering & Van Otterlo, 2012), online lecture series (Silver, 2015; van Hasselt et al., 2021; White & White, 2023), and documented codebases (Achiam, 2018; Raffin et al., 2019).

Despite the abundance of resources, students often struggle when first encountering RL.  Our practical teaching experience reveals several underlying causes. Textbooks offer comprehensive introductions to fundamental concepts, effectively explaining the modular nature of RL, where different exploration methods (e.g., ϵ-greedy), credit assignment methods (e.g., one-step on-policy estimates), and partial observability methods (e.g., windowing/frame-stacking) can be combined. However, students often find it difficult to translate equations into code and vice versa.  Without interactive practical examples, their learning process can be slow and challenging.

Documented public codebases offer a potential solution, enabling active experimentation. However, these present a different set of challenges.  Most RL test environments, typically based on the Gym paradigm (Brockman et al., 2016), are complex and high-dimensional, slowing down the experimentation cycle. While representation learning is an important aspect of RL, it can hinder understanding of fundamental concepts like on- and off-policy backups.  Classic control tasks like CartPole and MountainCar, often used for simpler experiments, possess specific characteristics that can confound multiple challenges and may not be suitable for illustrating every aspect of RL algorithms.

This highlights a gap in RL education.

FRANKFURT (Oct 24) - Deutsche Boerse said on Thursday it would ask a U.S. court to dismiss claims against its Clearstream unit stemming from a lawsuit filed by relatives of victims of the 1983 bombing of the U.S. Marine Corps barracks in Beirut.  The plaintiffs allege Clearstream's involvement facilitated Hezbollah in carrying out the attack during the Lebanese civil war.

Through Clearstream, Deutsche Boerse has been embroiled in this legal dispute with the U.S. plaintiffs seeking damages from Iran. As part of this action, the plaintiffs sought in 2008 to freeze Iranian funds held in Clearstream's Luxembourg-based securities account.  The U.S. amended a sanctions bill against Iran in August 2012, opening the door to further damages claims against foreign entities, including Clearstream.

Deutsche Boerse announced it had secured the necessary plaintiff approvals for a settlement.  "The requisite number of signatures has been obtained," the Boerse said in a regulatory statement.

I awoke in a brightly lit, unfamiliar room, struggling to sit up and understand my surroundings.  I'd fallen asleep on my living room couch with my dog, not here. I was still in my three-day-old clothes: my Hurley shirt, pizza-roll stain and all.  Confused, I scanned the room.  Five white doors punctuated the stark white walls, each bearing a single word in large black letters.  Beneath the words, a smaller inscription read: "Choose what you would like and remember there's absolutely no going back."

My eyes settled on the first door: Truth.  Before approaching, I squinted at a smaller sign: "Choose what you would like and remember there's absolutely no going back." Deciding to glimpse behind each door before choosing, I turned the knob of the Truth door, cracking it open just enough to peek through. The sight within made my stomach churn.  It was my girlfriend's room, the familiar scent of her Victoria's Secret perfume and lilac candle filling the air.  Then she stumbled in, with my best friend of thirteen years. I watched in horrified silence as they undressed and began to have sex.  Slamming the door shut, I collapsed in tears for what felt like hours but was only twenty minutes.  A scream tore through me, but I knew this wasn't the door I would choose.

The next door read: Peace.  I cracked it open as I had the last, and the view was breathtaking.  A seemingly endless forest stretched before me, filled with birds singing sweet melodies, butterflies with vibrant wings, and rabbits hopping along a wood chip path.  For a moment, I thought I’d found my choice.

But then I moved to the next door: Honor.  I skipped this one entirely, unsure of what lay beyond.  Was it everything I desired or something not even worth a glance?

The next door grabbed my attention: Power.  I imagined the possibilities – superhuman strength, flight, anything a superhero might possess.  Peeking through the crack, I saw an office, a couch, and an older gentleman followed by a younger woman.  She sat on the couch, he on a chair opposite her.  I strained to hear their conversation. "How have you been coping with anger this week?" the man asked. "Has it been getting better? Do you have any activities that make you happy? What makes you the *most* happy?"  A therapist? My power was…therapy? Disgusted, I slammed the door shut.

Finally, the last door: Fortune.  I peeked inside and saw everything I thought I wanted: a multi-million dollar house, a stunningly beautiful woman, a fleet of Lamborghinis and Ferraris. Without hesitation, I swung the door open and stepped into this life of luxury. I drove my dream cars and traveled the world, but I also saw a vision of my future self, dying of a heart attack at 39, alone and without ever finding true love.

Panicked, I raced back to the entrance, but the Fortune door was now locked, the word reversed.  I tried everything – an axe, hired help – but nothing worked. The door remained stubbornly sealed. Then, a letter slid from beneath it.

Deep learning has revolutionized visual classification [17, 39, 21, 32], achieving remarkable success thanks to large-scale labeled datasets [5]. While public datasets like ImageNet [9] enable superhuman performance on common object recognition, practical applications often involve categories with scarce data, such as medical images. This data scarcity limits the generalization of current vision systems, necessitating methods that can generalize to novel classes with limited labeled samples.  Cross-domain few-shot learning (CDFSL) addresses this challenge by recognizing novel categories in a target domain using few labeled samples.  Unlike general few-shot learning (FSL), where source and novel datasets come from the same domain, CDFSL involves distinct source and target domains with different feature distributions [52].

While FSL has seen promising advancements [44, 14, 37, 38, 11, 35, 46], state-of-the-art (SOTA) meta-learning based FSL methods struggle in CDFSL scenarios due to poor generalization and domain shift [6, 16].  Existing approaches have attempted to address this. Some introduce feature-transformation layers to simulate diverse feature distributions during training [41], but require extensive multi-domain data.  Others combine FSL and domain adaptation objectives [50], but assume identical label sets between domains, limiting their applicability.  Traditional transfer learning, where a feature extractor pre-trained on the source dataset is fine-tuned on the target dataset with few labeled samples, has shown superior performance in CDFSL benchmarks [16].  Building on this, methods like eigenvalue regularization [27] aim to mitigate negative knowledge transfer.

Our work focuses on the crucial role of generalization capability in cross-domain representation learning.  A strong feature extractor in the source domain doesn't guarantee good performance in the target domain due to differing feature distributions.  Overfitting to the source domain can lead to less discriminative or inseparable feature embeddings in the target domain (illustrated in Figure 1).  Conversely, a less perfect source domain extractor may generalize better and yield more discriminative target domain embeddings.  Figure 1(a) and (c) depict a less-generalized feature extractor performing well on the source but poorly on the target, while Figure 1(b) and (d) show a more generalized extractor with better target domain performance.

Inspired by the potential of multi-task learning for improved generalization [22], we propose a noise-enhanced supervised autoencoder (NSAE).  This approach leverages several key advantages.  First, it inherits the generalization benefits of supervised autoencoders [22] by jointly predicting input labels and reconstructing inputs. Second, inspired by the generalization-enhancing effects of noise injection during training [33, 2, 1], we treat reconstructed images as noisy inputs and feed them back into the system for further classification.  This avoids the need for handcrafted noise.  Third, a two-step fine-tuning procedure further adapts the model to the target domain.  Initial unsupervised tuning focuses on reconstructing novel class images, followed by supervised classification fine-tuning.  Theoretical analysis based on inter-class correlation (ICC) supports our intuition about generalization in CDFSL (Figure 1).  Finally, our method is easily integrated with existing transfer learning methods to boost performance.

Our key contributions are:

*  The first application of a supervised autoencoder framework to enhance generalization in few-shot learning.
*  The novel use of reconstructed images as noisy inputs for enhanced generalization, coupled with a two-step fine-tuning procedure for improved target domain adaptation.
*  Extensive experiments across multiple benchmarks, backbone architectures, and loss functions demonstrating the efficacy and robustness of our framework in CDFSL.

L'étonnant destin des œufs d'insectes consommés par les oiseaux a interpellé des chercheurs japonais des universités de Kobe, Kochi et Tokyo.  Se pourrait-il que certains œufs survivent au passage digestif et soient excrétés intacts ?  Leur étude, parue dans la revue *Ecology* du 28 mai, explore cette hypothèse.

Les chercheurs ont concentré leurs travaux sur les œufs de phasmes.  Plus résistants aux sucs digestifs des oiseaux, ces œufs présentent également l'avantage de pouvoir éclore sans fécondation préalable.  En effet, contrairement à la plupart des insectes, les femelles phasmes sont majoritairement parthénogénétiques, capables de se reproduire sans l'intervention d'un mâle.

Pour leur expérience, les scientifiques ont nourri des bulbuls à oreillons bruns (*Hypsipetes amaurotis*), des passereaux endémiques d'Asie, avec des femelles de trois espèces différentes de phasmes.  Leurs observations ont révélé que 5 à 20 % des œufs étaient excrétés intacts.  Mieux encore, pour l'une des espèces de phasmes, les œufs retrouvés dans les fientes ont donné naissance à des individus viables.

Cette découverte apporte un éclairage nouveau sur un paradoxe qui intrigua longtemps Charles Darwin : comment expliquer la dispersion d'insectes aptères, apparemment incapables de franchir de longues distances, entre les îles du Pacifique ?  La réponse se trouvait peut-être dans les déjections des oiseaux…

The familiar sting returned as my eyes snapped open. My heart hammered against my ribs, a frantic drumbeat in my ears. The metallic tang of blood coated my tongue. My body screamed for respite, but there was no time.

*Time,* I thought, *it's always about time.*

Gasping for breath, I watched the panicked stream of lab-coated figures surge past.  The blaring alarms justified their flight.  Rational, yes, but a luxury I couldn't afford.

The corridor was a river of fear, impossible to fight against.  I'd tried, once. It hadn't gone well.

A quick glance at my watch, and I started the countdown, setting my stance. Left foot forward, slight crouch, right arm back, fist clenched. I wasn't a violent man, but sometimes violence was necessary.

*3… 2… 1… Now!*

With practiced precision, I swung. My fist, aimed three inches above level, connected with the jaw of the 6'1", 300-pound security guard.  It wasn't easy to knock out someone that size with a single punch, but that was the plan, and it worked.

Frank crumpled, unconscious.  At least, I hoped he was unconscious. I didn't have time to check.

Snatching his gun, I flicked off the safety and fired three shots into the concrete ceiling.  The deafening roar echoed through the corridor, momentarily overriding the alarms.  The fleeing mob recoiled.

My opening.

I surged forward, the crowd parting before the apparent madman with a gun. Their fear was palpable, understandable.

Seconds later, I reached an emergency stairwell leading deeper into the complex.  I burst through the door, the stairwell blessedly empty, the lower levels already evacuated.  I descended, taking two, sometimes three steps at a time, until I reached the 34th step down from the 5th basement level.  That treacherous step. I slowed, adjusting my pace carefully.

The rest of the descent and the subsequent corridors on the 12th basement level were easy. I knew every turn. The challenge was the heavy door plastered with "Secure Personnel Only" warnings.  It required a twelve-digit code, known only to the assigned scientists. Me.  But there was no time for codes.  Sprinting, I raised the gun and fired the remaining two bullets into the keypad.  Practice and a sliver of luck paid off; the shots fried the circuitry, and the door slid open. I slipped through.

Inside was the source of the crisis: our particle accelerator. Malfunctioned? Or perhaps it had worked *too* well. We were researching antimatter, seeking a way to safely harness it for interstellar travel.  *Safely* being the operative word.  When we'd activated it earlier, everything had gone to hell.

My colleagues huddled against the far wall, knowing escape was futile.  Once the accelerator’s safety protocols failed, the resulting explosion would devastate half the country. They'd tried their best, but there was nothing left to do. Except what *I* could do.

I rushed to the main switchboard.

“Alexandra, get over here!” I yelled. My intern.  For some reason, she always obeyed me at this point.  She scrambled to join me at the console that controlled the mile-long machine housing our impending doom.

“Wh-where did you go? How did you—?” she stammered, understandably confused. Time was running out.

“Listen closely,” I said calmly. “I know how to stop this, but you need to do exactly as I say, without question. Got it?”

“I… yes. Of course.”

We began the complex sequence of inputs needed to avert disaster.  Alexandra, under immense pressure, performed flawlessly, following my instructions precisely. Until the final moments. It all came down to this.

“On three, I max the energy input, you hit the large red button to your left,” I instructed. She turned, shocked.

“ONE!”

“W-wait, what!?” Panic flared in her eyes.

“JUST DO IT! TWO!”

“THREE!”

I slammed the slider forward.  She… hesitated.  Fuck.

The furthest I'd gotten, and a single moment of hesitation had sealed our fate. Hers, our colleagues’, half the country’s.  Not mine.

As the explosion engulfed us, I closed my eyes, focusing.  I knew what to change. What to say to her.

I knew how to save everyone…

*I won’t have time to explain all of this to them.*

The familiar sting returned as my eyes snapped open…

英国半导体设计公司 Imagination Technologies 正考虑在伦敦进行首次公开募股（IPO）。彭博周五（10 日）援引消息人士报导了此消息。该公司为苹果(AAPL-US)设计芯片，目前由中资私募股权公司 Canyon Bridge 所有。

除了 IPO 之外，Imagination 也可能考虑出售，并正与投行 Lazard 合作研究各种战略替代方案。据消息人士透露，如果 Canyon Bridge 决定出售 Imagination，可能会增加更多顾问。不过，相关讨论尚处于早期阶段，交易能否最终达成尚不确定。Imagination、Lazard 及 Canyon Bridge 均对此未予置评，Canyon Bridge 甚至拒绝回应。

Imagination 于 2017 年被 Canyon Bridge 以 5.5 亿英镑（约 7.63 亿美元）的价格收购，随后从伦敦证券交易所退市。Canyon Bridge 在加州和北京都设有办事处，其资金全部来自国新控股。

此前，苹果曾在 2017 年宣布终止与 Imagination 的合作关系，导致 Imagination 股价暴跌，因为当时苹果的订单占其总收入的一半以上。不过，双方在 2020 年 1 月重修旧好，并再次签订了长期授权协议。

由于收购 Imagination 的私募股权公司 Canyon Bridge 受中企国新控股支持，Imagination  去年曾因其与中国国企国新控股的关系受到审查。当时，Imagination 董事会计划向国新控股派驻代表，引发英国政界的强烈反对，并导致该公司首席执行官 Ron Black 辞职。在该提议被撤回后，英国外交委员会要求 Imagination 临时首席执行官 Ray Bingham 保证，派驻代表的举动并非向中国转移技术计划的一部分。

My eyes slowly opened. I felt the impact, but saw and heard nothing.

"AND HEY, UH WHATS YOUR NAME???" I'd yelled in complete despair, moments before.

"FORD! HENRY, FORD!!" he'd roared back. The name meant nothing to me.

I remembered the slippery lever, creaking as I pulled it back, the sweat from my hand bunching up.  The faint orange light far below us. "Go, now!" he'd urged.  We were tilting downward, my stomach floating.

Just before that, amidst the hopelessness, we'd shared a moment of levity. "Hey F, if we do somehow get there alive, what's the first thing you're gon na do?" I’d wondered.

He'd chuckled, looking down. "I'm gon na have the dirtiest, grittiest, strongest cup of coffee I can find in all of New York."  We’d laughed.

The ship, sputtering through the darkness, its dimensional headlights flickering, was set for 1047 BD, 03, May. "Lets ride," he’d breathed nervously, typing in the coordinates. "If we make it out of this, we can get the jump on Brady's parents, but if that doesn't work, we're gon na have to get rid of Jesse. Those months’ll be more than enough if we’re quick and smart, just like before.”

“Or after, I guess you could say,” I’d joked. He'd let out a half-hearted chuckle and put the ship into drive.

I remembered finding the notebook – pages filled with lottery numbers, Super Bowl scores, World Series champions – 2001 Ravens 34-7 Giants, 1996 Cowboys 27-17 Steelers… 1906 White Sox, 1952 Yankees, 2016 Cubs… hundreds of them.  F, meanwhile, was focused on the ship’s controls, trying to find the ignition combo on the old dial lock.  I stuffed the notebook into my right pocket.  Just after, a high-pitched beep pierced the air, and a mix of purple and light green lights flashed onto his face.  "There's my old girl -- I'm gon na need a co for this one, just pull the lever when I give you the go," he’d explained.

“Check the glovebox for any painkillers or something,” F had suggested earlier. Inside, I’d found a wallet, a taped-together letter, and that leather notebook.

"When do you think is safe?" I'd asked him then.

"I don't know, maybe back to 2003, around March. That gives us about two months of leeway before Brady's born, and Jesse's already seven."  2003.  The year they said the world would end, I’d thought.

We’d been running through the ship's corridor, past vacant, wrecked rooms.  The metal footsteps echoing behind us. “Shit, wait,” I’d choked. We'd both frozen, eyes closed, breaths held.  The monster brushed against my chest. For a moment, I swore it stopped right in front of me, but we were spared.  "We're good..." he’d whispered. And we’d kept running. I'd finally collapsed, in disbelief, into the torn red leather passenger seat.

Earlier still, I’d rubbed the bandage on my right trap, feeling the dampness. I hadn't wanted to look. "You think that's gonna last for much longer?"

"Unmasking the Face on Mars"

The article "On the Face on Mars" presents a compelling blend of facts and opinions.  In 1976, while the Viking 1 spacecraft orbited Mars, photographing potential landing sites for Viking 2, it captured something unusual.  The spacecraft discovered what appeared to be an enormous face-like structure, nearly two miles long.  While some NASA scientists dismissed it as a typical Martian mesa, the image sparked speculation.  Could this be a natural landform, or did it hint at another life form?

The structure's shadows gave it an uncanny resemblance to an Egyptian Pharaoh.  NASA's official explanation, released days later, described the image as a "huge rock formation...which resembles a human head...formed by shadows giving the illusion of eyes, nose, and mouth."  Despite this, some continued to believe the face was artificially constructed. However, numerous natural processes could have created such a formation.  The article explores several possibilities, including the erosive effects of Martian winter weather and draws a comparison to the Middle Butte in the Snake River Plain.

The "Face on Mars" has sparked a lot of intrigue.  A few days after NASA's Viking 1 orbiter photographed the region of Cydonia, images revealed what appeared to be a human face. This naturally led to some wild speculation.  Given the time and resources dedicated to researching the possibility of human life on Mars, and the scientific consensus that it's currently uninhabitable, the idea of a human face on the planet seems impossible.  Some have even suggested aliens as a possible explanation.  Wouldn't we have found other evidence of their presence by now, though?

The most logical explanation, and the one supported by scientific evidence, is that the "face" is simply a natural landform.  While it initially seemed bizarre, this theory holds the most weight.

Upon closer examination, scientists identified the feature as just another Martian mesa, a common geological formation in the Cydonia region.  Subsequent, higher-resolution images confirmed this assessment, revealing the "face" to be a natural landform, debunking the idea of an alien monument.  All available evidence points to this single, conclusive explanation. The “face” on Mars is nothing more than a trick of light and shadow on a natural geological formation.

Mean field theory has demonstrated significant promise in analyzing algorithms widely used in machine learning and computer science.  Applications include optimizing shallow [Chizat and Bach, 2018; Chizat, 2022a] and deep neural networks [de G. Matthews et al., 2018; Pennington et al., 2017; Pennington et al., 2018; Xiao et al., 2018], and characterizing the average-case computational complexity of NP-hard problems [Ding et al., 2015].  The mean field regime is a theoretical framework for studying problems where the number of parameters or the input size approaches infinity. This overparameterization reveals coarse structures by effectively averaging out fine details.

However, a gap exists between the mean field regime and practical, finite-sized problems [Lewkowycz et al., 2020; Li et al., 2022; de G. Matthews et al., 2018].  Since mean field predictions don't necessarily hold in standard settings [Bach, 2021], recent research has focused on quantifying the accuracy of these predictions [Li et al., 2022].

Understanding the characteristics of major industrial accidents is crucial for prevention and mitigation. While some accidents are well-researched, others, like certain fire-related incidents, require further exploration.  For example, simply detecting a fire may not be sufficient for effective management.  Consider jet flames impinging on nearby pipes: depending on the flame's heat fluxes, the pipe wall could rapidly reach dangerous temperatures, potentially triggering a domino effect.  These heat fluxes can be categorized into three main zones within the flame [6], whose geometric characteristics and location are critical for risk management.

This paper explores the use of semantic segmentation for characterizing these flame zones, a technique potentially applicable to other fire-related accidents.  We evaluate different segmentation methodologies on a dataset of real propane jet fire images to accurately segment the radiation zones, defined here as the Central, Middle, and Outer Zones (illustrated in Figure 1).

The paper is structured as follows: Section 2 reviews existing literature on the problem and different semantic segmentation methods. Section 3 details the research approaches employed. Section 4 describes the dataset and pre-processing methods. Section 5 outlines the evaluation metrics and loss functions used. Section 6 details the training protocol for the Deep Learning architectures. Section 7 explains the testing procedure. Section 8 presents the results and discusses potential future work. Finally, Section 9 summarizes the key findings.

In industrial environments, certain activities, such as fuel storage and hazardous material transport, can lead to severe accidents impacting both the facility and surrounding areas, including human health, the environment, and property.  Therefore, a comprehensive understanding of these accidents is essential.

The "Face on Mars" has sparked speculation about alien involvement, but a rational examination reveals it's most likely a natural landform.  While some cling to the idea of extraterrestrial influence, the evidence strongly suggests otherwise.  This essay will address the two key arguments supporting the natural formation hypothesis: common sense and NASA's scientific findings.

The core argument revolves around whether the "Face" is an alien creation or simply a natural mesa. While some might be swayed by the idea of ancient alien artistry,  NASA's photographic evidence points towards the latter.  As stated in one source, the image depicts "the Martian equivalent of a butte or mesa—landforms common around the American West."  The clarity of the images, taken on a clear Martian day, further strengthens this conclusion.

Some might argue that crucial details are too small to be discerned in the photographs. However, Jim Garvin, the chief scientist for NASA's Mars Exploration Program, addressed this concern, explaining that discernible objects are typically "3 times bigger than the pixel size."  He added that even comparatively small objects like "airplanes on the ground or Egyptian-style pyramids or even small shacks" would be visible.  The high resolution and enhanced detail of the images, captured on a clear day, make it highly unlikely that artificial structures would be missed.

Admittedly, photographs alone can't definitively rule out the possibility of alien involvement.  Could an alien-made structure, disguised as a natural landform, exist?  Hypothetically, yes.  While I concede this remote possibility, the lack of any evidence supporting such a claim makes it highly improbable.

Considering the sheer improbability of aliens constructing a monument on Mars only to be discovered by humans, the argument for alien involvement weakens considerably.  While the available images depict the exterior, the interior remains unexplored, leaving a sliver of doubt. However, this sliver is so minuscule that it hardly warrants serious consideration.

In conclusion, the available evidence, including NASA's photographic data and logical reasoning, strongly supports the conclusion that the "Face on Mars" is a natural landform.  While the possibility of alien involvement can't be entirely dismissed, it lacks credible supporting evidence and relies on highly improbable scenarios.

全球升温哪怕0.5摄氏度，看似微不足道，但气候专家指出，将全球升温控制在比工业化前高1.5摄氏度，与升温2摄氏度相比，对地球上的生命可谓攸关生死。

升温2摄氏度，面临极端热浪的人口将比现在翻一番，面临水资源短缺的人口将新增2.5亿。北极夏季无冰也将从百年一遇变为十年一遇。

签署《巴黎协定》的各国承诺将全球平均升温控制在2摄氏度以内，最好是控制在1.5摄氏度以内。然而，目前全球气温已比工业化前基准高出1.1摄氏度。

联合国数据显示，即使各国兑现现有减排承诺，地球仍将走向升温2.7摄氏度的“灾难性”道路，距离目标仍相去甚远。

以下为联合国政府间气候变化专门委员会（IPCC）对全球升温1.5摄氏度、2摄氏度甚至更高情景下的分析：

**热浪：**

* 升温1.5摄氏度，部分地区最高温将增加3摄氏度；升温2摄氏度，部分地区最高温将增加4摄氏度。
* 十年一遇的热浪，在升温1.5摄氏度的情况下发生概率将增至4倍，升温2摄氏度则增至近6倍。
* 五十年一遇的极端炎热天气，在升温1.5摄氏度的情况下发生概率将增至近9倍，升温4摄氏度则暴增至40倍。

Rosalinda Powell Fox, más conocida como Rosalinda Fox, fue una mujer inglesa que mantuvo una relación amorosa con Juan Luis Beigbeder, delegado de Asuntos Indígenas y alto comisario en el Protectorado español en Marruecos durante la Guerra Civil Española. Su figura cobró especial relieve tras el libro de María Dueñas *El tiempo entre costuras*, una novela española que narra la vida de Sira Quiroga, una joven modista que abandona Madrid antes del comienzo de la guerra civil española y, por capricho del destino, se ve obligada a fundar un taller de alta costura en Tetuán, capital del Protectorado Español en Marruecos en aquella época.  Fox ha protagonizado varios libros, entre ellos el mencionado de Dueñas, posteriormente llevado a la televisión.

Fox habitó varios años en Guadarranque, y en su memoria, desde el 28 de febrero del pasado año, el Parque de Mayores de la barriada lleva su nombre.  Como homenaje, se organizaron paseos literarios por Guadarranque para recorrer los lugares relacionados con sus vivencias en la zona, guiados por la escritora Mariángeles Chozas y vecinos de la barriada.

El primero de estos paseos se realizó el pasado martes con la participación de una veintena de personas.  La Concejalía de Bibliotecas de San Roque, que dirige Dolores Marchena, anunció ayer que el segundo paseo, previsto inicialmente para ayer mismo, se ha aplazado hasta el viernes 17 debido al mal tiempo.

En Guatemala, familias reciben Q1,000 durante tres meses para paliar la crisis del coronavirus. (Foto Prensa Libre: Hemeroteca PL)

¿Le arrebataron su recibo de luz o sospecha que alguien lo tomó?  Los beneficiarios del Bono Familia pueden denunciar estos casos ante el Ministerio Público (MP).

La información para acceder al beneficio se encuentra en el recibo de luz de quienes, afectados por el coronavirus, consumieron menos de 200 kWh.  Esto ha convertido a dichos recibos en objeto de robo.

El MP recibe denuncias sin que usted tenga que salir de casa, a través de dos opciones:

**Opción 1:**  Realizar la denuncia mediante la aplicación "Reportes MP" (disponible para Android).

**Opción 2:**  Realizar la denuncia en la página web mp.gob.gt.

El MP reportó que entre el 25 y el 29 de mayo se recibieron 75 denuncias relacionadas con el recibo de luz, el cual contiene la información necesaria para que los beneficiarios puedan retirar o utilizar los Q1,000 depositados por el Gobierno.

Las denuncias más frecuentes son el arrebato o retención del recibo por parte del dueño del inmueble alquilado, o la falta de entrega del mismo a los usuarios del servicio.

Según Zamahel García, de la Oficina de Atención Permanente del MP, estas conductas pueden encuadrarse en delitos como apropiación y retención indebida, coacción y hurto.

My Dearest Friend,

I know it is rare to hear from me, but these are desperate times. The people are gripped by fear, and it is spilling into unrest. I wish I could explain fully, but circumstances permit me little time for detail. You once lived here, in a time of happiness and prosperity. Though your departure saddened us, we parted as friends and countrymen.  However, the music box, your parting gift, the source of so much joy throughout the land, has fallen silent.

I confess I know neither your current location nor your well-being.  It's even possible this letter reaches you no more. Yet, if you are alive and receive this message, I implore you to return home with all haste. Your people need you. I understand you intended to leave permanently, but I fear your adventures may not yet be concluded.

You have always been a true friend, ever ready to lend aid when I was in need, as I have been to you. While I know you owe me nothing, perhaps a favor owed to the monarch of one of the world's wealthiest nations might hold some sway.

My friend, I pray this message finds you swiftly. Remember the power of the music box, its vital role in the stability of our kingdom – a role it still holds.  Our recent economic hardships have made its influence more crucial than ever. Despite my best efforts, the nobility refuse to cede any power to the crown, hindering my ability to address this crisis. Therefore, I beseech you, return home and help us restore our nation to greatness and stability.


Sincerely,

Queen Bertha II of House Sinclair

## 不工作的世界：疫情后的省思 (Revised Text)

**书籍介绍**

《不工作的世界：AI时代战胜失业与不平等的新经济解方》（天下文化出版）探讨在科技快速发展下，未来可能没有足够工作供所有人就业的挑战。作者丹尼尔．萨斯金（Daniel Susskind），牛津大学经济学家，针对此一迫切议题，提出深刻的见解。

**疫后时代最迫切的经济问题**

本书的核心问题是：科技进步，尤其自动化，如何影响未来的工作？历史经验表明，科技创新往往创造新工作，弥补被取代的劳动力。然而，萨斯金指出，人工智能的突破性进展，例如AlphaGo战胜人类棋士，预示着机器无需复制人类思维，也能超越人类能力。这使得“科技性失业”的威胁更加真实。

疫情加速了自动化进程，也突显了本书的现实意义。疫情爆发初期，人们以为经济很快就能恢复，但事实并非如此。疫情造成的经济衰退，核心问题在于劳动市场。疫情前，许多地方的就业市场已面临薪资停滞、不安全感加剧等问题。疫情加剧了这些问题，导致失业率飙升，不仅因为自动化，也因为防疫措施抑制了对劳动力的需求。

正如书中所述，我们面临的核心挑战是“分配障碍”。科技进步可以创造更多财富，但如何公平分配这些财富？疫情期间，大规模失业使这个问题更加突出。各国政府不得不采取前所未有的财政措施，例如发放补助金，以支持失业者和经济。这使得“基本收入”的概念，从边缘走向主流。

**瞥见未来**

疫情也让我们预见科技巨头日益增长的力量。在疫情期间，大型科技公司表现出色，其市值占比不断攀升。萨斯金关注的不仅是它们的经济实力，更是其日益增长的政治影响力，以及对自由、民主和社会正义的潜在影响。例如，疫情期间，数据隐私和安全问题一度被淡化，各国政府和企业加强了数据收集和监控。我们需要警惕并限制科技巨头的权力扩张。

除了经济和政治挑战，我们还面临着“意义”的挑战。工作不仅提供收入，也赋予人生意义。如果工作消失，人们将如何找到生活的目标？萨斯金认为，工作和意义之间的联系并非牢不可破。许多人并未从工作中获得满足感，疫情期间，一些人甚至因为摆脱了不合适的工作而感到解脱。

然而，如何在一个没有工作的未来找到人生意义，仍然是一个未解之谜。疫情期间，人们转向各种休闲活动，例如烘焙、园艺等，也引发了关于工作与生活平衡、家庭和社区价值等问题的讨论。这些讨论表明，我们需要重新思考人生的意义和价值。

萨斯金主张，面对这些挑战，政府需要扮演更重要的角色——“大政府”，以确保社会繁荣的成果能够公平分配。

One of the most critical and challenging tasks facing modern society is providing personal and medical care for vulnerable and frail individuals, whether due to age or health conditions.  This includes childcare for children and social care for adults needing assistance with activities of daily living (ADLs).  While the state plays a significant role in care provision for these groups in most developed countries, formal and informal care within households and kinship networks remains crucial for their well-being.  As populations age and birth rates decline in developed nations, many governments face a substantially increasing demand for care.

In the UK, this demand is exacerbated by a dwindling supply of carers due to declining birth rates, even as the aging population requires increasing support [6].  A recent Age UK report…  [Incomplete sentence needs completion or removal]

This paper presents an agent-based model (ABM) of the UK's informal and privately-funded formal care system.  Our goal is to capture the complex interplay between social and childcare and the impact of social policies on these processes.  This model provides a theoretical framework for understanding the intricate care allocation system, where demographic, social, and economic factors interact to determine the dynamics of care demand and supply.  Furthermore, using ABMs allows us to model economic and social policy changes, providing a means to test policies aimed at affecting childcare and social care provision. This approach can reveal potential unintended consequences (spillover effects) before real-world implementation.

Previous work has explored social care provision and policy solutions using ABMs [12, 16].  Our simulation significantly extends these efforts by modeling care provision not as a simple transaction but as a negotiation within kinship networks, influenced by numerous social, economic, and geographic factors.  Therefore, we propose that this model can more comprehensively support and inform childcare and social care policy-making than other methods.

Landform or Alien?

The Face on Mars: a natural landform or an alien artifact? While I believe it's simply a natural formation, many suspect alien involvement. This public interest has made investigating the Face on Mars a high priority for NASA, prompting us to conduct thorough research.

Our initial investigation began with the Mars Global Surveyor (MGS), which reached the Red Planet in September 1997, eighteen years after the Viking mission concluded.  Despite the time gap, we felt continued exploration was crucial and a responsible use of taxpayer funds.  Our primary objective was to capture high-resolution images of the Face.

Finally, on April 5, 1998, the MGS flew over the Cydonia region, home to the Face.  Michael Malin and his Mars Orbiter Camera team secured an image ten times sharper than the original Viking photographs.

The night was typical. This neighborhood, brimming with wealth and unsuspecting residents, was my hunting ground. Their arrogance, their air of superiority, almost justified relieving them of their possessions.  They thought they were better than everyone else.  Well, if they were so smart, why leave a spare key dangling inside a birdcage by the back door? Birds make terrible guard dogs.

The kitchen was unremarkable. The living room, equally so. An Xbox One sat gathering dust – a console nobody with discerning taste wanted, rendering it worthless to me.

A small collection of Buddha statues and some burning incense hinted at open-mindedness, peace, and a complete lack of repression.  Right.

Upstairs, I opened the bedroom door.  My wife. Asleep in the bed. No. It just *looked* like her.  It was unsettling, uncanny.  She was alone, dead to the world – not literally, she was breathing – just deeply asleep. I moved closer.

The resemblance was astonishing.  They could have been twins.  I scanned the room and decided to take some family photos to show my wife.  She'd be more freaked out than me.

Maintaining my professional composure, I pocketed a few pieces of jewelry and left quickly.

Back home, I presented the jewelry to my wife.  She was unimpressed. "I've had better," she quipped. That's why I loved her – her sharp wit, her ability to call me on my bullshit. We kept each other honest.  Then, I showed her the photographs.

Silence.  Her eyes welled up.  The resemblance could only mean one thing: a twin sister. She had to meet her.  "Now?" she whispered.  "No," I replied, "it's the middle of the night.  In the morning."  Sleep would be elusive.

We made coffee, and the childhood stories resurfaced: her parents, early school days, the divorce, moving, new friends… the usual.  There had always been an unspoken tension surrounding her parents, a sense of something missing.  Perhaps this was the reason for their rift.

Not that it mattered now.  They were gone.  It was just us. And maybe, one other.

As soon as dawn broke, we were at the house. My wife trembled with nerves, adrenaline coursing through her.  It sounded absurd, but I could almost hear her heart pounding.

She pressed the doorbell.  I stood beside her, offering silent support. Goosebumps prickled her arms. Footsteps approached.

The door opened. The moment their eyes met, pure, unadulterated rage erupted.

(NOTICIAS YA).- Un jurado declaró culpable a Datwon Armstrong, de 30 años, por agredir a un oficial de policía de Denver el lunes, según informó la fiscal de distrito, Beth McCann.

El 12 de julio, Armstrong viajaba como pasajero en un vehículo que fue detenido por la policía, de acuerdo con la fiscalía. Tras verificar las placas y licencias, los oficiales descubrieron que el vehículo estaba involucrado en un incidente de atropello y fuga.

Armstrong huyó a pie y, durante la persecución policial, disparó cuatro veces contra los agentes, según las autoridades.  Ningún oficial resultó herido ni respondió a los disparos.

Finalmente, Armstrong fue encontrado escondido cerca de la intersección de West Ohio Avenue y North Hazel Street, donde fue arrestado.  La fiscalía indicó que se recuperó una pistola Magnum .357 cerca del lugar.

Armstrong tenía dos órdenes de arresto pendientes por delitos graves, relacionadas con la evasión de la justicia en otras jurisdicciones de Colorado. La audiencia de sentencia está programada para el 13 de noviembre de 2020.

El padre Luis Sanjines, "cura villero" que trabaja con adictos y personas en situación de calle en barrios como Villas los Sauces y San Pablo, Villa Asunción, asentamiento Alta Tensión y Villa Primavera, exige cambios en el sistema judicial tras un intento de robo en su parroquia de Villa Primavera, San Pedro Apóstol.  

Ayer por la madrugada, tres hombres intentaron ingresar a la iglesia, donde también reside el párroco. Dos de ellos, de 22 y 23 años y oriundos de Atocha,  fueron detenidos por la Policía durante un patrullaje de rutina al detectar el portón forzado. El tercer asaltante logró escapar.  Este hecho, sumado a robos previos, como el de unas macetas registradas por las cámaras de seguridad que él mismo instaló, lo impulsó a alzar la voz no solo por él, sino también por los vecinos que, según relata, acuden a la iglesia en busca de consuelo ante la constante inseguridad.  

"Vienen impotentes, sienten que los delincuentes se burlan de ellos", afirma Sanjines, quien advierte sobre el riesgo de la justicia por mano propia ante la falta de respuestas. "El que es más rápido gana",  señala, aunque rechaza esta alternativa.  La inseguridad lo ha llevado a considerar medidas adicionales como elevar la medianera que separa su casa de la iglesia y sumar un perro guardián, además de las cámaras que ya posee.

El padre Sanjines critica la flexibilidad del sistema judicial, argumentando que "encuentran un sistema donde están unas horas y salen, la flexibilidad en la ley hace que reincidan, no que desistan".  Rodeado de cámaras de seguridad,  asegura que penas más duras son el camino para acercar la justicia a vecinos "impotentes, desprotegidos y burlados".  Considera que  "somos hijos del rigor".

El cura, que ofrece comida a personas en situación de calle y adictos cada sábado en la parroquia ("El pan no se le debe negar a nadie", expresa),  desarrolla una amplia labor social, incluyendo talleres y el proyecto Hogar de Cristo, un albergue para personas con adicción impulsado por el papa Francisco cuando era cardenal.  "Ya conseguimos el tinglado, pero necesitamos más ayuda", comenta con entusiasmo.

Con el mismo ímpetu con el que busca apoyo para sus proyectos sociales,  Sanjines reclama cambios en el sistema judicial.  Ya se ha contactado con un diputado quien, asegura, "está trabajando en el tema". Para el religioso, la ayuda social y un sistema judicial más firme son dos caras de la misma moneda.  "Es importante hacer un trabajo de contención, pero también tiene que haber un sistema más firme para que no dé más lugar a esto. Las dos cosas son necesarias, si no el trabajo está medio hecho", concluye.

The proliferation of complex data, such as non-Euclidean graphs and multi-view data, driven by advancements in information technology, presents significant challenges for data analysis.  Multi-view data arises from diverse sources with varying characteristics. Multi-relational graphs, a specific type of multi-view data, contain multiple relations over a single set of vertices (Qu et al. 2017).  A prime example is seen in social networks, where users (nodes) and their profiles (attributes) interact through various relationship types like friendship, colleagues, or co-following.

Clustering offers a practical approach to analyze these rich multi-relational graphs by identifying unique node cluster patterns.  Effective multi-relational clustering leverages the consistency and complementarity among multiple views. Existing methods like SwMC (Nie et al. 2017), O2MAC (Fan et al. 2020), and MCGC (Pan and Kang 2021) employ strategies such as weighted graph learning and adaptive weighting to generate a high-quality graph from the original multi-relational data. Graph filtering, a key component of these methods, fuses topological structure and attribute information. Notably, impressive performance can be achieved even without neural networks (Lin et al. 2023; Pan and Kang 2023b), demonstrating the potential of representation learning techniques for traditional machine learning. However, these methods often rely on simple, fixed low-pass filters without fully considering inter-view correlations.

Exploring these correlations is crucial in multi-view learning.  Lyu et al. (2022) theoretically demonstrated the effectiveness of correlation-based objective functions in extracting shared and private information under certain assumptions.  Among these, Barlow Twins (Zbontar et al. 2021) has gained popularity.  It maximizes the correlation of the same features across different views (invariance term) while decorrelating different features (redundancy term).  This feature decorrelation not only leverages multi-view correlations but also mitigates representation collapse in self-supervised learning. While adopted in graph clustering methods like MVGC (Xia et al. 2022) and MGDCR (Mo et al. 2023), these applications often lack specific adaptations for multi-relational graphs, leading to persistent collapse issues. This is illustrated in Figure 1, which visualizes feature distributions for representative methods on ACM data: MGCCN (Liu et al. 2022b), MGDCR (Mo et al. 2023), and our proposed method, Barlow Twins Guided Filter (BTGF).  Comparing Figures 1(a) and 1(b) highlights the benefits of Barlow Twins, while Figures 1(b) and 1(c) reveal further improvement with BTGF.

This work demonstrates that a negative semi-definite inner product input establishes a lower bound for Barlow Twins loss, while a positive semi-definite input yields an upper bound. To minimize the loss, we utilize a graph filter to ensure a positive semi-definite inner product, effectively establishing an upper bound for Barlow Twins and preventing the loss from dominating other terms. Figure 2 depicts the overall architecture for multi-relational clustering.  The graph filter aggregates neighbor information for each node, producing smooth representations.  An encoder maps these representations into a clustering-favorable space, and a decoder reconstructs them.  Clustering results are obtained from the encoder output after training.

民进党立委王定宇被爆料与民进党发言人颜若芳同居，一周内前往女方台北住处多达五次，甚至有亲密举动。对此，王定宇回应表示，他与颜若芳只是房东与房客的关系，他的妻子也知道此事。
